string.text: Redirection of powder gasses
Redirecting the powder gasses to counteract the effects of muzzle climb makes recoil easier to handle for the shooter.
Wear-resistant muzzle attachment point
Significantly slows down the wear and tear of the weapon, especially when used in combination with a silencer.
Barrel with modified rifling pitch
Changing the rifling pitch in the barrel can improve muzzle velocity for a flatter bullet trajectory.
Barrel alignment
Calibrate barrel alignment with the sights and remove any excessive movement that occurs during the firing cycle.
Protective coating
The application of a special coating to the moving components can significantly reduce the amount of wear they receive.
Install a hardened extractor
Improves overall reliability of the weapon by reducing the number of common ejection issues that can occur after firing.
Improved barrel locking mechanism
Provides a tighter seal in the chamber and increases bullet obturation with the bore, improving muzzle velocity.
Chamber alignment
Careful fitment of parts and minimization of backlash in the chamber for a better seal, improving accuracy.
Lightweight frame
Replacing the standard frame with a lightweight alternative reduces the overall weight of the weapon, without sacrificing reliability or other features.
Reinforced trigger assembly
A refined trigger assembly allows for a faster rate of fire at the expense of some overall reliability.
Ergonomic grip
Replacing the original grip panels with modern alternatives makes the weapon slightly easier to hold and handle.
Polymer buffer
Adding a polymer buffer to the return mechanism absorbs some of the recoil energy generated by firing.
Calibrate the trigger group
Precision adjustment and balancing of the trigger components allows for higher accuracy and reduced recoil.
Polymer magazine
Replacing the magazine with a modern lightweight equivalent reduces the overall weight of the gun slightly.
Tritium inserts
Installation of luminous night-sights allows for easier target acquisition in low-light conditions.
Lightweight polymer components
Replacing standard parts with lightweight polymer alternatives significantly reduces the weight of the gun.
Heavy-duty components
Replacing standard parts with analogs made of high-strength alloys increases the weapon's durability.
